a.g: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -
Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment
The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah, seeking to make it (seem) deviant. Those are in extreme error.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book4
Indeed, the Almighty has said: "Those who prefer the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya] over the Hereafter [al-akhirah]." Thus, He described the disbelievers with that, so its understood meaning is that the believer is the one who is characterized by its opposite, which is that he prefers the Hereafter [al-akhirah] over the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya].

a.g: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

And [recall, O Children of Israel], when Moses said to His people, "Remember the favor of Allah upon you when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.' "
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 10
Know that God the Exalted has coupled gratitude [shukr] with remembrance [dhikr] in His Book, even though He has said: "And the remembrance of God is greater" {}. Thus He the Exalted said: "So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me" {}. And He the Exalted said: "What would God do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe?" {}. And He the Exalted said: "And We will reward the grateful" {}. And God the Exalted has decreed increase with gratitude without exception, for He said: "If you are grateful, I will surely increase you" {}. Yet He made exception in five matters: in granting sufficiency, in answering, in provision, in forgiveness, and in repentance. For He said: "Then God will suffice you from His bounty, if He wills" {}. And He said: "He removes that for which you supplicate Him, if He wills" – and He said: "He provides for whom He wills without account" and He said: "And He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills" and He said: "And God turns in forgiveness to whom He wills." And this is a created trait from the traits of Lordship, for He the Exalted said: "And God is Most Appreciative [Shakūr], Forbearing" {}.

a.g: And Moses said, "If you should disbelieve, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."

Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 2
Indeed, for this reason, Allah the Exalted said: "Is there any doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?" [14:10]. And for this reason, He sent the prophets—may the blessings of Allah be upon them—to call the creation to *Tawhid* [التوحيد], so that they would say, "There is no god but Allah," and they were not commanded to say, "We have a god and the world has a god," for that was already ingrained in the innate disposition [فطرة] of their intellects [عقولهم] from the beginning of their origin and in the prime of their youth.
Vol3 book5a
Indeed, for this reason, Allah the Exalted said: "Is there any doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?" [14:10]. And for this reason, He sent the prophets—may the blessings of Allah be upon them—to call the creation to *Tawhid* [التوحيد], so that they would say, "There is no god but Allah," and they were not commanded to say, "We have a god and the world has a god," for that was already ingrained in the innate disposition [فطرة] of their intellects [عقولهم] from the beginning of their origin and in the prime of their youth.

a.g: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

And why should we not rely upon Allah while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allah let those who would rely [indeed] rely."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 8
Indeed, and Allah the Exalted has said: "And we will surely be patient over what you harm us, and upon Allah let the reliant [al-mutawakkilun] rely." And as for from the verses: Indeed, Allah the Exalted has said: "And upon Allah rely [fatawakkalū], if you should be believers." And the Almighty has said: "And upon Allah let the reliant [al-mutawakkilun] rely." And Allah the Exalted has said: "And whoever relies upon Allah [yatawakkal 'alā Allāh] – then He is sufficient for him." And He, glorified and exalted, has said: "Indeed, Allah loves the reliant [al-mutawakkilun]." And how great is a station [maqām] marked by the love [maḥabba] of Allah the Exalted its possessor, and guaranteed by the sufficiency [kifāya] of Allah the Exalted its companion. So, for whom Allah the Exalted is his Sufficiency [ḥasbuhu] and his Provider [kāfīhi] and his Beloved [muḥibbuhu] and his Guardian [murā'īhi]: then he has attained the great success [al-fawz al-'aẓīm]. For the beloved [al-maḥbūb] is not punished, nor distanced, nor veiled [yuḥjab]. And He the Exalted has said: "Is not Allah sufficient for His servant?" So, the seeker of sufficiency [kifāya] from other than Him and the abandoner of reliance [tawakkul] is the one who denies this verse. For it is a question in the form of an elicitation of the truth [istiṇṭāq bi-al-ḥaqq], like His saying the Exalted: "Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing mentioned?" And the Almighty has said: "And whoever relies upon Allah [yatawakkal 'alā Allāh] – then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise." That is, Mighty ['azīz] – He does not humiliate the one who seeks refuge in Him, nor does He waste the one who clings to His side and seeks the protection of His sanctuary and His safeguard; and Wise [ḥakīm] – He does not fall short in managing the affairs of the one who relies [tawakkala] upon His management. And Allah the Exalted has said: "Indeed, those you call upon besides Allah are servants like you." He made clear that everything other than Allah the Exalted is a subjugated servant ['abd musakhkhar]. Its need is like your need, so how can one rely [yatawakkal] upon it? And Allah the Exalted has said: "Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you [any] provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him." And the Almighty has said: "And to Allah belong the treasuries of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand." And the Almighty has said: "He arranges [each] matter; there is no intercessor except after His permission." And everything mentioned in the Qur'an regarding divine oneness [tawḥīd] is an alerting to severing observation [mulāḥaẓa] from the others [al-aghyār] and relying [tawakkul] upon the One, the Subduer [al-Qahhār].

a.g: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.
And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book3
And We proceeded and sought permission from a third, and he said: "Enter, if you do not distract us from our Lord [Rabb]." So I recited: "That is for him who fears My standing [maqām] and fears My threat [wa'īd]." And he gasped a gasp, and blood appeared from his nostrils, and he began to thrash in his blood until he dried up, and We left him in his state.

a.g: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 9a
Indeed, the Almighty has said, "And they sought victory, and disappointed was every obstinate tyrant [jabbar 'anid]." Indeed, God has censured arrogance [kibr] in several places in His Book, and He has censured every tyrant [jabbar] who is arrogant [mutakabbir]. Thus He, the Almighty, said, "And they sought victory, and disappointed was every obstinate tyrant [jabbar 'anid]." And He, the Almighty, said, "Indeed, He does not love the arrogant [mustakbirin]." And He, the Almighty, said, "They had certainly grown arrogant [istakbaru] within themselves and become insolent with great insolence ['utuwan kabiran]." And He, the Almighty, said, "Indeed, those who are arrogant [yastakbiruna] about worshipping Me will enter Hell in humiliation." And the censure of arrogance [kibr] in the Qur'an is abundant. And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr] will not enter Paradise, and he in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of faith [iman] will not enter the Fire." And Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "God, the Almighty, says: 'Grandeur [al-kibriya'] is My cloak, and majesty [al-'azamah] is My garment. So whoever contends with Me for one of them, I will cast him into Hell, and I do not care.'" And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man continues to exalt himself until he is recorded among the tyrants [al-jabbarin], and then befalls him what befalls them of punishment." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will emerge from the Fire a neck having two ears that hear, two eyes that see, and a tongue that speaks. It will say: 'I have been entrusted with three: with every obstinate tyrant [jabbar 'anid], and with everyone who called upon another god alongside God, and with the image-makers.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The miser, nor the tyrant [jabbar], nor he of bad character will enter Paradise." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Paradise and the Fire argued. The Fire said: 'I have been favored with the arrogant [al-mutakabbirin] and the tyrannical [al-mutajabbirin].' And Paradise said: 'What is the matter with me that none enter me except the weak, the lowly, and the incapable among the people?' So God said to Paradise: 'You are but My mercy [rahmati]; I show mercy through you to whom I will of My servants.' And He said to the Fire: 'You are but My punishment ['adhabi]; I punish through you whom I will.'"

a.g: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Then look, after this, at the foulness of the pus [ṣadīd] which flows from their bodies until they drown in it, and it is the boiling filth [ghasāq]. Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said: The Messenger of God, peace be upon him, said: "If a bucket of the boiling filth [ghasāq] of Hell were poured out upon the world [dunyā], it would corrupt the people of the earth." So this is their drink when they cry out for relief from thirst; the hottest among them is given water of pus [ṣadīd] to swallow, and he can scarcely get it down, and death comes to him from every direction, yet it does not kill him. And if they cry for help, they are helped with water like molten brass [muhl], which scalds the faces. How wretched a drink, and how evil a resting place!

a.g: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, Abu Umamah said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said regarding His, the Exalted's, statement: "And he will be given to drink of purulent water [ma' sidid]; he will gulp it but can hardly swallow it" (14:17). He said: "It is brought near to him, and he detests it. When it is brought close to him, it scorches his face, and the skin of his head falls off. When he drinks it, it cuts his intestines until it exits from his anus. God, the Exalted, says: 'And they will be given to drink scalding water [ma' hamim] that will cut through their intestines' (47:15). And the Exalted says: 'And if they cry for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass [ma' kal-muhl] that scalds the faces' (18:29). So this is their food and their drink in their hunger and their thirst."

a.g: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.
Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.
And that is not difficult for Allah.

And they will come out [for judgement] before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, Malik ibn Anas, may God be pleased with him, said: Zayd ibn Aslam said concerning His, the Exalted's, statement: "It is all the same for us whether we show patience [ṣabarnā] or are not patient [jazāʿnā]; for us there is no escape [maḥīṣ]" (14:21). He said: They were patient [ṣabarū] for one hundred years, then they were in anguish [jazʿū] for one hundred years, then they were patient [ṣabarū] for one hundred years, then they said: "It is all the same for us whether we show patience [ṣabarnā] or are not patient [jazāʿnā]."

a.g: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allah] before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."

And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"
Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book6
Then from this seed is born the tree of love [mahabba] and knowledge [ma'rifa], and it is the goodly word [al-kalimah al-tayyibah] for which Allah set forth a parable when He said: "Allah sets forth a parable of a goodly word like a goodly tree, its root firm and its branches in the sky." And to it is the allusion in His saying, exalted is He: "To Him ascends the goodly word [al-kalim al-tayyib]," meaning knowledge [ma'rifa], "and the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] raises it." So the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] is like beauty for this knowledge [ma'rifa] and like a servant. And indeed, all righteous action [al-'amal al-salih] is in purifying the heart [qalb] first from the world [dunya], then in preserving its purity. So action is not desired except for this knowledge [ma'rifa].
Vol1 book 9
Then from this seed is born the tree of love [mahabba] and knowledge [ma'rifa], and it is the goodly word [al-kalimah al-tayyibah] for which Allah set forth a parable when He said: "Allah sets forth a parable of a goodly word like a goodly tree, its root firm and its branches in the sky." And to it is the allusion in His saying, exalted is He: "To Him ascends the goodly word [al-kalim al-tayyib]," meaning knowledge [ma'rifa], "and the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] raises it." So the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] is like beauty for this knowledge [ma'rifa] and like a servant. And indeed, all righteous action [al-'amal al-salih] is in purifying the heart [qalb] first from the world [dunya], then in preserving its purity. So action is not desired except for this knowledge [ma'rifa].

a.g: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.
And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.
Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book4a
Indeed, until it is said: "O you, who is your Lord [Rabb] and what is your religion [din] and who is your Prophet [Nabi]?" So he says: "My Lord is Allah, my religion is Islam, and my Prophet is Muhammad, peace be upon him." Then he is rebuked with a severe rebuke, and it is the final opportunity presented to the deceased. So if he says that, a caller calls out: "You have spoken truthfully." And this is the meaning of His saying, the Most High: **"Allah keeps firm those who have believed with the firm word [al-qawl al-thābit]."** Then there comes to him one coming, beautiful of face, pleasant of scent, beautiful of garments, and he says: "Receive glad tidings of the mercy [rahma] of your Lord and gardens wherein is enduring bliss [naʿīm]."
Vol4 book10
Indeed, until it is said: "O you, who is your Lord [Rabb] and what is your religion [din] and who is your Prophet [Nabi]?" So he says: "My Lord is Allah, my religion is Islam, and my Prophet is Muhammad, peace be upon him." Then he is rebuked with a severe rebuke, and it is the final opportunity presented to the deceased. So if he says that, a caller calls out: "You have spoken truthfully." And this is the meaning of His saying, the Most High: **"Allah keeps firm those who have believed with the firm word [al-qawl al-thābit]."** Then there comes to him one coming, beautiful of face, pleasant of scent, beautiful of garments, and he says: "Receive glad tidings of the mercy [rahma] of your Lord and gardens wherein is enduring bliss [naʿīm]."

a.g: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?

a.g: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.
And they have attributed to Allah equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."

[O Muhammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange, nor any friendships.

It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.
And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.
And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 8
Indeed, for this reason, Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, used to say: "O Allah, I seek Your forgiveness for my injustice [zulm] and my ingratitude [kufr]." So it was said to him: "This is the injustice [zulm], but what of the ingratitude [kufr]?" So he recited the saying of the Almighty, the Majestic: "Indeed, man is ever unjust [zalum] and ungrateful [kafur]."

a.g: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.
My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Know that if the entry into the Fire [al-nar] becomes a reality for groups among the believers, then Allah, the Exalted, by His grace [fadl], accepts on their behalf the intercession [shafa'a] of the Prophets and the Truthful [al-siddiqin], indeed the intercession of the scholars [al-'ulama'] and the righteous [al-salihin], and everyone who has standing [jah] and good dealings [husn mu'amala] with Allah, the Exalted—for he has intercession for his family, his relatives, his friends, and his acquaintances. So be diligent in acquiring for yourself a rank of intercession with them. And that is by never despising any human being at all, for Allah, the Exalted, has concealed His friendship [wilaya] within His servants; perhaps the one your eye looks down upon is the friend [wali] of Allah. And never deem any sin [ma'siya] insignificant at all, for Allah, the Exalted, has concealed His wrath [ghadab] within sins; perhaps the displeasure [maqt] of Allah is in it. And never deem any act of obedience [ta'a] insignificant at all, for Allah, the Exalted, has concealed His pleasure [rida] within obedience; perhaps His pleasure is in it, even if it is a good word [al-kalima al-tayyiba] or a good intention [al-niyya al-hasana] or what is similar to it. And the evidences for intercession in the Qur'an and the reports [akhbar] are many. 'Amr ibn al-'As reported: "Indeed, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, recited the saying of Ibrahim, upon him be peace: **'My Lord, indeed they have led astray many of the people. So whoever follows me, then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me—indeed, You are Forgiving, Merciful'** (Qur'an 14:36), and the saying of 'Isa, upon him be peace: **'If You should punish them, indeed they are Your servants'** (Qur'an 5:118). Then he raised his hands and said: 'My Ummah, my Ummah,' and wept. So Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: 'O Jibril, go to Muhammad and ask him what makes him weep.' So Jibril came to him and asked him, and he informed him—and Allah knows best—so He said: 'O Jibril, go to Muhammad and say to him: Indeed, We shall please you concerning your Ummah and We shall not grieve you.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"I have been given five things not given to anyone before me: I am aided by terror [al-ru'b] for a month's journey; spoils of war [al-ghanima] have been made lawful for me and were not lawful for anyone before me; the earth has been made a place of prostration [masjid] and its soil pure [tahur] for me, so wherever a man from my Ummah is overtaken by the prayer, let him pray; I have been granted intercession [al-shafa'a]; and every prophet was sent to his own people specifically, but I have been sent to all people generally."** And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"On the Day of Resurrection, I will be the leader of the prophets, their orator, and the possessor of their intercession—without boasting."** And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"I am the master of the children of Adam, and I do not boast; I am the first for whom the earth will split open; I am the first intercessor and the first whose intercession is accepted; in my hand will be the banner of praise, beneath it will be Adam and those after him."** And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"For every prophet there is a supplication that is answered. I wish to reserve my supplication as intercession for my Ummah on the Day of Resurrection."** And Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"Pulpits of gold will be erected for the prophets, and they will sit upon them, but my pulpit will remain—I will not sit upon it—standing before my Lord, upright, fearing that I will be sent to Paradise while my Ummah remains after me. So I will say: 'O Lord, my Ummah!' And Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will say: 'O Muhammad, what do you wish Me to do with your Ummah?' So I will say: 'O Lord, hasten their reckoning.' And I will not cease interceding until I am given writs for men who have been sent to the Fire, and until Malik, the keeper of the Fire, says: 'O Muhammad, you have left no remnant for the Fire from the wrath of your Lord concerning your Ummah.'"** And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: **"Indeed, I will intercede on the Day of Resurrection for more than what is on the face of the earth of stone and clay."** And Abu Hurayrah said: "Some meat was brought to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and the forearm was raised to him—and it used to please him—so he took a bite from it. Then he said: **'I am the master of the messengers on the Day of Resurrection. And do you know why that is? Allah will gather the first and the last on a single plain; the caller will make them hear, and sight will penetrate; and the sun will draw near until the people reach a distress and anguish they cannot bear...'"**

a.g: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.
Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.
Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."
And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 10a
Indeed, do not reckon [tahsib] Allah to be heedless [ghafil] of what the wrongdoers [al-zalimun] do. He only defers them for a Day when eyes will stare [tashkhasu] in horror. And so on, from what has come in the Book of Allah, the Exalted, and the Sunnah of His Messenger. Whoever believes in this is saved from this delusion [ghurur], for the origin of this delusion and ignorance [jahl] is ignorance of Allah and His attributes [sifat]. For whoever knows Him [arafa] does not feel secure from His plan [makr], nor is he deluded by such false imaginings [khayalat]. And let him look to Pharaoh, Haman, Korah, and to the kings of the earth, and what befell them—how Allah was good to them at first, then utterly destroyed them! So He, the Exalted, said: "Do you perceive [tahissu] from them anyone?" The verse.
Vol4 book10
Indeed, do you not remember what God, the Exalted, has warned you through the tongue of His Messenger, where He said: **"And never think that God is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror] – Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts [af'idah] are void. And warn the people..."** So how great is your joy today in rinsing your mouth with the reputations of people and taking their wealth, and how severe will be your regrets on that Day when your Lord stands upon the carpet of justice and you are presented for the address of governance, while you are bankrupt, poor, incapable, and humiliated, unable to restore a right or present an excuse. At that time, your good deeds [hasanat], for which you toiled your entire life, will be taken and transferred to your adversaries in compensation for their rights.

a.g: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.

And, [O Muhammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, they will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a near term, that we may answer Your call and follow the messengers." And God, the Exalted, will answer them, "Did you not swear before that you would have no end?" Then they will say, "Our Lord, bring us out, that we may do righteous deeds other than what we used to do." And God, the Exalted, will answer them, "Did We not grant you a lifespan in which he who would remember could remember? And the warner came to you. So taste! For the wrongdoers there is no helper." Then they will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness [shaqawah] overcame us, and we were a people astray. Our Lord, bring us out of it; if we return [to evil], then indeed we are wrongdoers." God, the Exalted, will answer them, "Be driven away into it, and do not speak to Me." So they will not speak after that, ever. And that is the ultimate severity of the punishment.

a.g: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."
And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.
So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
[It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, do not imagine that that earth [al-ard] is like the earth of this world [ard al-dunya]. Rather, it does not equal it except in name. The Most High has said: "On the Day the earth will be changed to another earth, and the heavens [al-samawat] as well." Ibn Abbas said: It will be increased in it and decreased, and its trees, its mountains, its valleys, and what is in it will depart. And it will be stretched out like the stretching of the tanned hide of 'Ukaz—a white earth like silver, upon which no blood has been spilled and upon which no sin has been committed. And the heavens [al-samawat] will depart—their sun, their moon, and their stars.

a.g: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,

And indeed, He has forbidden the *safn* and the *safd* in prayer. And the *safd* [safd] is the joining of the two feet together, and from it is His saying, the Most High: "...bound together in fetters [asfad]."

a.g: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.
So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
This [Qur'an] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.
